newsitem.title: USA: TENNIS-FERNANDEZ TO PLAY SUGIYAMA IN OPENING FED CUP SINGLES.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-FERNANDEZ TO PLAY SUGIYAMA IN OPENING FED CUP SINGLES.

text.p: Mary Joe Fernandez meets Ai Sugiyama in a rematch of a spirited Wimbledon encounter a year ago to launch the U.S.-Japan Fed Cup qualifying playoff Saturday at Longwood Cricket Club.
"I won it but it was a real tough match," said the 13th-ranked Fernandez, recalling her difficult three-set match with Sugiyama in the fourth round of the 1996 Wimbledon championships.
In the second singles match Saturday, Olympic champion Lindsay Davenport, ranked eighth in the world and an impressive 12-2 in Fed Cup singles, will face Naoko Sawamatsu.
The singles competition resumes Sunday with Davenport against Sugiyama, and Fernandez facing Sawamatsu.
A doubles match will follow, with Davenport and Lisa Raymond opposing Naoko Kijimuta and Nana Miyagi.
The winner of the tie will join the eight-team competition to determine next year's team championship title.
The United States, winners of 15 Fed Cup titles since the start of the competition in 1963, lost to the Netherlands in the first round this year.
Last year, the U.S. team beat Japan 5-0, but captain Martina Navratilova says the Americans are taking the challenge seriously.
"We have a different team and they have a different team, so it's a whole new ballgame," she said. "But that doesn't mean we're not confident."
Japanese captain Takeshi Koura is not just looking for a good showing. "We plan to win," said Koura. "Our experience in the big tournaments like Wimbledon has made our team more confident this year."
"We know the Americans are very good, but we have two strong singles players who are very well prepared."
Sugiyama is ranked 25th in the world, and Sawamatsu 45th.
